boat.full_description:
'Cormorant' was designed and built by Lukes of Hamble in 1911. She was rebuilt by Peter Brookes, then of Maldon. Work included most of the sawn oak frames and steamed timbers being replaced. All iron strap floors were replaced with new laminate iroko floors, new dead-woods and ally-bronze keel bolts were fitted. She was completely refastened and had a new teak cockpit. Her sails are made by the sailmakers Cormorant Sails.

After being based in Tollesbury, where she was often seen being paddled back to her mooring, she returned to Cowes in 2016.
boat.name: Cormorant
boat.short_description: Engineless gaff yawl built 1911 by Lukes of Hamble
